summary: An email forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) from an individual reporting a suspicious contact in July 2019 via the Seeking Arrangements platform, allegedly from Jeffrey Epstein or Ghislaine Maxwell, seeking a recruiter to 'bring home girls to Daddy.' The tipster suggests the FBI subpoena the platform's records from Palm Beach.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The tipster alleges that Epstein, possibly with Ghislaine Maxwell, reached out via Seeking Arrangements in July 2019 around the time of his arrest, seeking a recruiter to bring girls to him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The tipster alleges that Maxwell, possibly with Jeffrey Epstein, reached out via Seeking Arrangements in July 2019, seeking a recruiter to bring girls to Epstein.

connections.description: The tipster alleges they were acting together in July 2019 to recruit via the Seeking Arrangements platform.

events.title: Alleged Recruiting Contact via Seeking Arrangements
events.description: An individual reports being contacted via the Seeking Arrangements platform, allegedly by Jeffrey Epstein and/or Ghislaine Maxwell, with a proposition to act as a recruiter to 'bring home girls to Daddy.'

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Apprehended
events.description: The tipster notes the contact occurred around the time Jeffrey Epstein was apprehended (arrested in July 2019).

keyFacts: A tipster alleges contact in July 2019 via the Seeking Arrangements platform from someone purporting to be Jeffrey Epstein and/or Ghislaine Maxwell, seeking a recruiter to 'bring home girls to Daddy.'
The contact originated from Palm Beach, Florida.
The tipster suggests the FBI subpoena records from Seeking Arrangements to investigate this potential recruiting method.
The tip expresses concern about involvement but a desire to help achieve justice for victims.
The correspondence was forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) in November 2021.
